reviews.review:
If you have not heard of this game yet, stop living under a rock, then buy it.
If you have and have not bought it, buy it.
If you have already bought the game, play it.

This is a sequel to an extremely innovative puzzle game.

Pros: 
-Innovative
-Good Graphics
-Music that never gets annoying
-Virtually infinite community made test chambers (levels)
-A co-op mode for 2
-Humor
-A plot twist(?)
-Secrets

Cons:
-Short main game mode (Less than 3 hours if you know what you are doing) 
         -(Some may not consider this bad)

I recomend this game.
Really fun,  Always wanted to play this and finally decided to get it.  It was worth the purchase and has a good laugh at points while playing
A great game even better than the first one.
Wheatley only needs a hug.

Наверное, самая лучшая компиляция элементов.
В меру весело, в меру кооперативно, в меру интересный сюжет, в меру сложные достижения.
Возможно, каждый элемент в отдельности можно было сдлеать лучше, но сочетание их создает действиетльно подобрано идеально.

one of the best games.

Portal 2 quickly became my favourite game when I first played it over 5 years ago and it still very much is today. It stands the tests of times and is an enjoyable experience even after the first playthrough. It is a game that I recommend to everyone, no need to have played the prequel either.

Up front, it may seem like just a puzzle game that features unique mechanics and a silly story behind it, but it certainly excels as one. The puzzles are all fairly challenging, forcing you to be constantly thinking of new ways of approaching situations and utilizing your resources. New mechanics are constantly being introduced as well, building upon old ones and at a good pace too which helps develop these puzzles.

But it is with the story that Portal 2 begins to really shine. The few characters in the game are all written and portrayed excellently guiding you through the puzzles as you delve deeper and deeper into the game. You begin realizing that there is a lot more going on and just can not wait to beat the puzzle to find out more. And trust me, the story is worth getting through and won't leave you dissapointed.

The game itself isn't too long and should take less than 10 hours to beat. But even after that, there is a whole lot more to do with the co op mode. Several more hours of Portal for you to enjoy, this time alongside a friend, providing you all new challenges and ways to play the game. Now hopefully taht is enough reason for you to stop reading this review now and just go buy and play the game... for science!
I have to wrtite a review about a game. Still love it.

Portal 2 is a perfect game. The single player is a fun adventure aand challenge that won't take too long, the voice actors are great and their dialogue make me laugh and keep me hooked. The game mechanics are quality, is not too basic and far fromn complicated. The puzzles and level design are interesting and not too difficult. Some levels will test you but, you can always get through them. The multiplayer is incredibly fun and it almost makes for a third Portal game. It also runs fine on almost any PC, even the most basic of potatoes. All in all a perfect game.

Portal 2 is the fantastic sequel to the original Portal, expanding upon the story and gaming mechanics of the original. I found the puzzles to be fun and challenging, and there are plenty of creative uses to be found for the portal gun and the various gels. The story is also longer and more detailed than the original. I would definitely recommend this game.
